definitions: rope or cord used for binding or securing something tightly
severe beating or whipping delivered as punishment or attack
examples: The cargo was secured with heavy lashings to prevent shifting
We need extra lashings to tie down the equipment properly
The storm delivered a fierce lashing of rain and wind
The prisoner received twenty lashings for attempting escape

definitions: informal term for a young woman or girl, especially in Scotland
examples: The bonnie lassie sang traditional Scottish songs beautifully
Every lassie in the village attended the harvest dance

definitions: long rope with running noose used for catching cattle or horses
examples: The cowboy expertly threw his lasso around the calf
She practiced swinging the lasso in wide circles overhead

definitions: simple fastening device for doors or gates consisting of movable bar
examples: The garden gate latch needs oil because it squeaks
Make sure the latch clicks securely when closing doors

definitions: time interval between stimulus and response or between cause and observable effect
examples: Network latency can affect online gaming performance significantly
The medication has a latency period before becoming effective

definitions: movement or position to the side rather than forward or backward
sideways pass in football thrown parallel or backward from scrimmage line
examples: The lateral movement helps strengthen different muscle groups
The surgeon made a lateral incision along the ribcage
The quarterback threw a perfect lateral to avoid tackle
That lateral play resulted in a surprising touchdown victory

definitions: the most recent news, fashion, or development in any field
examples: Have you heard the latest about the company merger
She always wears the latest in designer fashion trends

definitions: flexible rubber-like material used in gloves, balloons, and other products
milky fluid found in many plants that coagulates on exposure to air
examples: Medical professionals wear latex gloves for patient examinations
Some people have serious allergic reactions to latex products
The rubber tree produces latex that drips when tapped
Natural latex from plants contains proteins and other compounds

definitions: thin flat strip of wood used to form foundation for plaster or tiles
examples: The old house walls were built with lath and plaster
Wooden lath provides excellent support for stucco application methods

definitions: machine tool that rotates workpiece to perform cutting, sanding, or drilling operations
examples: The carpenter shaped the table leg on his wood lathe
Metal lathes require proper safety equipment and careful operation

definitions: angular distance north or south from earth's equator measured in degrees
scope for freedom of action, thought, or decision within set limits
examples: The ship's latitude was forty degrees north of the equator
Tropical regions exist between specific latitude lines on maps
Teachers have considerable latitude in designing their lesson plans
The contract gives us latitude to adjust pricing as needed

definitions: communal toilet facility, especially in camps, barracks, or outdoor settings
examples: Soldiers cleaned the latrine as part of morning duties
The camping area had basic latrines near each site

definitions: espresso coffee mixed with steamed milk, typically served in tall glass
examples: She ordered a vanilla latte with extra foam on top
The barista created beautiful latte art with the milk

definitions: structure of crossed wooden or metal strips forming regular pattern of open spaces
examples: Climbing roses grew beautifully on the garden lattice structure
The pie had a decorative lattice crust on top

definitions: person who praises or glorifies someone or something enthusiastically
examples: Critics became lauders of her groundbreaking artistic vision overnight
The senator was a consistent lauder of military service members

definitions: device or platform designed to launch projectiles, rockets, or other objects
examples: The military tested their new missile launcher in desert conditions
The app launcher helps organize programs on your computer desktop

definitions: act of setting something in motion, especially ship, rocket, or new venture
examples: The ship launching ceremony attracted thousands of spectators yesterday
The product launching exceeded all our sales expectations this quarter

definitions: platform from which rockets or space vehicles are launched into flight
examples: The rocket sat on the launchpad awaiting final countdown
Cape Canaveral has multiple launchpads for different mission types

definitions: illegal process of concealing origins of money obtained through criminal activities
process of washing and ironing clothes or linens to make them clean
examples: The investigation uncovered extensive money laundering through shell companies
Banks must report suspicious transactions to prevent money laundering
The hotel handles laundering of all guest linens and towels
Professional laundering can extend the life of delicate fabrics

definitions: person honored for achievement in arts, sciences, or other fields of excellence
examples: The Nobel laureate delivered an inspiring acceptance speech yesterday
She became the country's first poet laureate at age thirty

definitions: aromatic evergreen shrub with dark green leaves used in cooking
wreath or crown symbolizing victory, honor, or distinction in achievement
examples: Bay laurel leaves add wonderful flavor to soups and stews
The Mediterranean garden featured several varieties of laurel shrubs
Athletes in ancient Greece received laurel wreaths for victories
She refused to rest on her laurels after winning the award

definitions: informal shortened term for lavatory or bathroom
examples: The airplane lav was occupied during most of the flight
There's a public lav just around the corner from here

definitions: molten rock expelled by volcano during eruption that solidifies as it cools
examples: The lava flowed slowly down the volcano's slopes toward town
Ancient lava flows created these unique geological formations over millennia

definitions: room or compartment with toilet and washing facilities, especially in public buildings
examples: The restaurant lavatory was exceptionally clean and well maintained
Aircraft lavatories must comply with strict safety regulations and standards

definitions: aromatic plant with purple flowers used in perfumes and aromatherapy
pale purple color resembling the flowers of the lavender plant
examples: The lavender fields in Provence attract tourists every summer
She added dried lavender to the potpourri for fragrance
The bridesmaids wore dresses in a soft lavender shade
He painted the nursery walls a calming lavender color

definitions: process of creating, debating, and enacting laws through legislative bodies
examples: Congressional lawmaking involves multiple committees and lengthy debates
Citizens can participate in lawmaking through petitions and advocacy

definitions: law enforcement officer, especially sheriff or marshal in western contexts
examples: The old lawman had kept peace in town for decades
Federal lawmen investigated the interstate crime ring thoroughly last year

definitions: medicine or substance that stimulates bowel movements to relieve constipation
examples: The doctor prescribed a mild laxative for temporary relief
Natural laxatives include prunes and other high fiber foods

definitions: state of being loose, slack, or not strict in standards or discipline
examples: The coach wouldn't tolerate laxity in training discipline anymore
Security laxity at the facility led to several preventable incidents

definitions: act of putting something down carefully in horizontal position or arranging systematically
examples: The laying of underground cables requires careful planning and permits
Proper laying of tiles ensures a level and durable floor

definitions: person without professional or specialized knowledge in particular area
examples: The lawyer explained the verdict in terms a layman could understand
As a layman in finance, he relied on professional investment advice

definitions: termination of employment, typically of multiple workers for economic reasons
examples: The company announced layoffs affecting five hundred factory workers
Many employees found new jobs quickly after the unexpected layoff

definitions: way in which parts of something are arranged or laid out systematically
examples: The magazine layout featured stunning photography and clean typography
We need to approve the floor layout before construction begins

definitions: period of rest or waiting between stages of journey, especially flights
examples: We had a six hour layover in Chicago between flights
The layover gave us time to explore the airport shops

definitions: basketball shot made from near the basket, usually off the backboard
examples: She scored an easy layup after stealing the ball cleanly
Players practiced layups from both sides of the basket daily

definitions: open area of grassy land, especially one used for grazing
examples: Sheep grazed peacefully in the verdant lea beside the stream
The morning mist rose gently from the lea at sunrise

definitions: substance that drains away or is removed by percolating liquid
examples: Heavy rains can leach nutrients from the soil over time
The leach from the landfill contaminated nearby groundwater sources significantly

definitions: process by which soluble substances are washed out from soil or other materials
examples: Leaching of minerals affects soil fertility in tropical regions
The leaching process is used to extract metals from ore

definitions: printed sheet of paper containing information or advertising, usually distributed free
examples: Volunteers distributed leaflets about the upcoming community event downtown
The medical leaflet explained possible side effects of the medication

definitions: unwanted escape or loss of liquid, gas, or other substance from container
examples: The plumber fixed the pipe leakage in the basement yesterday
Data leakage poses serious security risks for many companies today

definitions: person or thing that is thin, containing little fat or excess
examples: The marathon runner was much leaner than the weightlifter
This cut of meat is leaner and healthier than others

definitions: tendency or preference toward particular opinion, interest, or course of action
examples: Her political leanings became clear during the debate last night
The judge must set aside personal leanings when making decisions

definitions: game where players vault over each other's backs in turn
examples: Children played leapfrog during recess on the playground yesterday
The leapfrog tournament brought back fond childhood memories for everyone

definitions: act of jumping or springing forcefully from one place to another
examples: The deer's graceful leaping saved it from the predator
His heart was leaping with joy at the unexpected news

definitions: legal contract granting use of property for specified time in exchange for payment
examples: They signed a two year lease for the downtown apartment
The lease agreement includes all maintenance and utility responsibilities clearly
